spirometry.title: Spirometry
spirometry.subtitle: Basic and most common lung function test
spirometry.description: Spirometry is a simple, non-invasive test that measures the amount and speed of air a patient inhales and exhales. It helps determine how well the lungs function and whether the airways are narrowed or otherwise damaged.
spirometry.shortDescription: Basic lung function test measuring air volume and speed
spirometry.additionalInfo: Spirometry is considered the gold standard for evaluating lung function. The examination is fast, safe, and provides valuable information about the respiratory system. Results help doctors not only with diagnosis but also with monitoring treatment effectiveness.
spirometry.preparation: The examination requires no special preparation. However, we recommend not eating heavy meals 2 hours before the test and not smoking at least 1 hour beforehand.
spirometry.duration: The entire examination takes approximately 15-20 minutes
spirometry.results: Results are available immediately after completion of the examination
uses: When COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease) is suspected
For chronic cough or shortness of breath
As part of occupational health examinations
spirometry.importance: It is a fast and reliable method to detect breathing disorders early – even when the patient does not yet experience significant symptoms.
spirometry.contraindications: The examination is not suitable during acute respiratory infections, recent myocardial infarction, or unstable angina pectoris.

bodyplethysmography.title: Bodyplethysmography
bodyplethysmography.subtitle: Advanced lung function testing
bodyplethysmography.description: Bodyplethysmography is an advanced lung function test that allows us to precisely measure lung volumes and airway resistance. The examination takes place in a special transparent cabin where the patient sits and breathes according to the healthcare provider's instructions.
bodyplethysmography.shortDescription: Advanced examination in a specialized cabin for precise lung volume measurement
bodyplethysmography.detailed: This type of measurement provides important information that standard spirometry cannot reveal, such as residual lung volume (air remaining in the lungs after exhalation) or precise total lung volume.
bodyplethysmography.additionalInfo: Bodyplethysmography provides the most accurate measurement of lung volumes and is irreplaceable in differential diagnosis of restrictive and obstructive lung diseases. It also allows precise determination of bronchial hyperreactivity.
bodyplethysmography.preparation: Patients should wear comfortable clothing and avoid tight garments. Dental prostheses must be removed before the examination.
bodyplethysmography.results: Comprehensive results are available within 24 hours
uses: In patients with shortness of breath that cannot be explained by standard spirometry
For differential diagnosis of lung diseases
To monitor the development of lung diseases and treatment effectiveness
When lung hyperinflation or emphysema is suspected
bodyplethysmography.importance: Bodyplethysmography is the gold standard among lung function tests. If you have chronic breathing problems, shortness of breath, or already have a diagnosed lung disease, this examination provides the doctor with the most comprehensive view of how your lungs function.
bodyplethysmography.contraindications: The examination is not suitable for patients with claustrophobia, severe heart failure, or unstable vital functions.

fenoAnalyzer.title: FeNO Analyzer
fenoAnalyzer.subtitle: Measuring nitric oxide in exhaled air
fenoAnalyzer.description: FeNO (Fractional exhaled nitric oxide) is a gaseous marker of inflammation in the airways that can be precisely measured using a specialized device – the FeNO analyzer. Nitric oxide (NO) is produced in the lungs during allergic or eosinophilic inflammation – typical for asthma.
fenoAnalyzer.shortDescription: Sensitive examination of airway inflammation, especially in asthma
fenoAnalyzer.procedure: The examination is very simple, fast and non-invasive – the patient simply slowly exhales into the device.
fenoAnalyzer.additionalInfo: FeNO measurement represents a revolutionary method in asthma diagnosis and monitoring. It enables objective assessment of inflammatory activity in airways and helps with personalized asthma treatment.
fenoAnalyzer.preparation: Patient should not smoke, eat, or drink for at least 1 hour before the examination. Bronchodilator use should also be discontinued.
fenoAnalyzer.normalValues: Normal FeNO values in adults are less than 25 ppb
fenoAnalyzer.whenUsed: What is FeNO measurement used for?
uses: For diagnosis and monitoring of asthma
To detect inflammation in the airways
To assess the suitability and dosage of inhaled corticosteroids
To monitor treatment compliance in asthmatic patients
To distinguish between allergic and non-allergic types of inflammation
When monitoring effectiveness of anti-inflammatory treatment
In differential diagnosis of chronic cough
steps: Patient slowly exhales into the device mouthpiece after inhalation following instructions
The examination takes only a few tens of seconds
Repeated measurement may be performed for more accurate results
fenoAnalyzer.importance: FeNO measurement is important for precise asthma treatment management and early detection of inflammatory activity in the airways.
fenoAnalyzer.contraindications: The examination is not suitable during acute respiratory infections or in patients who cannot cooperate.

oscillometry.title: Oscillometry
oscillometry.subtitle: Modern method for airway assessment
oscillometry.description: Oscillometry is a modern method for assessing airways without effort from the patient. It measures airway resistance and lung tissue elasticity during quiet breathing.
oscillometry.shortDescription: Airway examination without patient effort during quiet breathing
oscillometry.advantages: Particularly suitable for children, elderly people, or patients who cannot perform standard spirometry.
oscillometry.additionalInfo: Oscillometry uses the principle of forced oscillations to measure mechanical properties of the respiratory system. It is more sensitive than spirometry in detecting peripheral airway obstruction.
oscillometry.preparation: Requires no special preparation, patient simply breathes quietly
oscillometry.results: Results are available immediately after examination
uses: In small children and elderly people
When unable to cooperate during spirometry
When peripheral airway obstruction is suspected
oscillometry.importance: Oscillometry provides information about airway function even in patients who are unable to actively cooperate in classic functional examinations.
oscillometry.contraindications: Virtually no contraindications, suitable even for small children and severely ill patients.

breathCoAnalyzer.title: Breath CO Analyzer
breathCoAnalyzer.subtitle: Measuring carbon monoxide in exhaled air
breathCoAnalyzer.description: The breath CO analyzer measures the concentration of carbon monoxide (CO) in exhaled air. This examination is primarily used to monitor smoking and assess carbon monoxide exposure.
breathCoAnalyzer.shortDescription: Carbon monoxide concentration testing for smoking control
breathCoAnalyzer.additionalInfo: Breath CO measurement is an objective method for evaluating smoking and exposure to toxic gases. It is an important tool in smoking cessation and monitoring treatment success.
breathCoAnalyzer.preparation: Patient should not smoke for at least 4 hours before examination for accurate results
breathCoAnalyzer.normalValues: Normal values in non-smokers are less than 10 ppm
uses: When carbon monoxide poisoning is suspected
breathCoAnalyzer.importance: Fast and precise method for assessing smoking levels and exposure to harmful gases.

sleepStudy.title: Sleep Study Polygraphy
sleepStudy.subtitle: Sleep disorder diagnosis
sleepStudy.description: Sleep study polygraphy is a specialized device for diagnosing sleep disorders, including sleep apnea. The examination is performed in the patient's home environment.
sleepStudy.shortDescription: Sleep disorder and sleep apnea diagnosis in home environment
sleepStudy.additionalInfo: Home polygraphy represents a convenient and effective method for diagnosing sleep apnea. It allows examination in the patient's natural environment, which increases result accuracy.
sleepStudy.preparation: Patient receives detailed instructions for proper sensor placement before sleep
sleepStudy.duration: Examination takes place throughout the night (6-8 hours of sleep)
sleepStudy.results: Results are available within 3-5 working days
sleepStudy.parameters: Monitors respiratory activity, oxygen saturation, heart rate, and body position
uses: In patients with hypertension of unknown etiology
sleepStudy.importance: Essential examination for diagnosing and treating sleep disorders that can significantly affect quality of life.
sleepStudy.contraindications: Relative contraindications in patients with severe cognitive impairments.

pulseOximeter.title: Handheld Pulse Oximeter
pulseOximeter.subtitle: Measuring blood oxygen saturation
pulseOximeter.description: A handheld pulse oximeter is a portable device for quick and accurate measurement of blood oxygen saturation and heart rate. It is used for immediate patient status assessment.
pulseOximeter.shortDescription: Quick measurement of oxygen saturation and heart rate
pulseOximeter.additionalInfo: Pulse oximetry is a non-invasive method for continuous monitoring of blood oxygenation. It is indispensable in acute conditions and long-term monitoring of patients with respiratory diseases.
pulseOximeter.preparation: Requires no special preparation, only clean nails without polish
pulseOximeter.results: Results are immediately visible on display
uses: In patients with chronic lung diseases
pulseOximeter.importance: Fast and reliable method for assessing blood oxygenation, which is crucial for early recognition of respiratory problems.
pulseOximeter.contraindications: May be inaccurate in patients with circulation disorders or carbon monoxide poisoning.

lungDiffusion.title: Lung Diffusion Testing
lungDiffusion.subtitle: Measuring gas transfer across lung membrane
lungDiffusion.description: Lung diffusion testing measures the lungs' ability to transfer gases (especially oxygen) from alveoli to blood. This examination provides information about lung membrane function.
lungDiffusion.shortDescription: Testing the lungs' ability to transfer oxygen to blood
lungDiffusion.additionalInfo: Diffusion capacity is a key indicator of alveolar-capillary membrane function. Reduced diffusion capacity may be an early sign of interstitial lung diseases.
lungDiffusion.preparation: Patient should not smoke for at least 24 hours before examination
lungDiffusion.principle: The test uses carbon monoxide as a test gas for measuring diffusion capacity
uses: In patients with shortness of breath of unknown cause
lungDiffusion.importance: Key examination for diagnosing lung tissue diseases and assessing gas exchange in the lungs.
lungDiffusion.contraindications: Not suitable for pregnant women and patients with severe heart failure.
